definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: Making dead wood more blessed than living lips.
sentences.chinese: 使枯木比活生生的雙脣更爲幸福。

sentences.english: The living statue sank to one knee before its drow master and awaited its orders.
sentences.chinese: 這座活生生的魔像跪在卓爾主人面前，等待他的命令。

sentences.english: Does she smother to death animatedly like this?
sentences.chinese: 難道她就這樣要活生生的憋死嗎？

sentences.english: It is an amazing film which brings dinosaur alive on screen.
sentences.chinese: 這是一部將活生生的恐龍搬上銀幕的精彩電影。

sentences.english: All of this led to the creation of a "mouse grimace scale".
sentences.chinese: 這一切就構成了老鼠一張活生生的“鬼臉”。

sentences.english: Software Description: About Dragons Lair, An animated mythical dragon flys across your screen.
sentences.chinese: 活生生神話的龍橫跨你的屏幕飛行。

sentences.english: Flames shoot from the mouth of a literal burner who just shotgunned a can of lamp oil.
sentences.chinese: 一名活生生的火人嘴裏射出火焰，他剛噴出一罐燈油。

sentences.english: I don't care if you're a living man-god.
sentences.chinese: 我不在乎您是否是一位活生生的上帝。

sentences.english: They are the living proof that it can be done.
sentences.chinese: 他們是活生生的例子，證明能夠實現目標。

sentences.english: A gene is the basic unit of heredity in a living organism.
sentences.chinese: 基因是遺傳的基本單位，在一個活生生的有機體。

sentences.english: And just how specific was the art de vivre practiced by the Cathars?
sentences.chinese: 伽他利實踐活生生的藝術有多具體？

sentences.english: He looked the living image of siva .
sentences.chinese: 他看上去像活生生的溼婆。

sentences.english: Many people are still buried alive after the earthquake.
sentences.chinese: 在地震過後，仍有很多人被活生生埋着。

sentences.english: Dreams are my reality, the only kind of real fantasy.
sentences.chinese: 夢境就是我真實的生活，一種活生生的幻想。
我就是一個活生生的例子。

sentences.english: Merleau-Ponty Shit is a bowel movement of the lived and existential body.
sentences.chinese: 大便是我們活生生的存有身體的腸部活動。

definition: to be badly mangled or mutilated (idiom)
half dead (of torment, hunger, tiredness etc)/(tired) to death/(terrified) out of one's wits/(beaten) to within an inch of one's life/(knock) the daylights out of sb
human shape/in human form/of human appearance/doll/puppet
to be drenched with blood/dripping blood
to dismember/(fig.) to break into parts
to die tragically/to meet with a violent death
